content.title: Adson Test
content.description: Provocative maneuver for thoracic outlet syndrome evaluation

key_concepts.details: Patient extends neck, rotates toward symptomatic side, deep inspiration; monitor radial pulse
Diminution or loss of radial pulse with reproduction of symptoms
High false-positive rate; many asymptomatic individuals have positive tests
Reproduction of symptoms more important than pulse obliteration alone

content.clinical_significance: Part of TOS physical examination but limited sensitivity and specificity
content.statement: Adson Test is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Rare-Syndromes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
